subjects.course_name: Design Thinking for Entrepreneurship and Startups
subjects.prerequisites: Good knowledge of Fundamentals of Software Engineering and Management
course_outcomes: Describe entrepreneurship and visualize designing processes for business.
Construct innovative thinking and design creative products and services.
Evaluate market needs and focus on prototype development.
Develop ideas and prepare business plans.
Recognize and analyze implications of IPR in a global context.

subjects.prerequisites: Basic programming logic, Data Structure & Algorithm concepts, Basic mathematics and digital electronics
course_outcomes: Define role of Operating System and explain OS design and control units.
Analyze CPU scheduling, synchronization and deadlock handling.
Explain paging, segmentation and virtual memory concepts.
Explain protection and security and compare UNIX and Windows OS.
Understand I/O systems, device management and disk scheduling algorithms.
Define and analyze complexity of algorithms.
Explain different algorithmic techniques and compare their behavior.
Discuss graph traversal and related algorithms.
Understand complexity classes like P, NP, NP-hard and NP-complete.
Define and evaluate approximation and randomized algorithms.
Apply algorithmic case studies to solve real problems.

subjects.prerequisites: Basic programming concept and problem-solving logic
course_outcomes: Understand core ideas of OOP and its advantages.
Use constructors, polymorphism and string handling to solve problems.
Implement inheritance, abstract classes, interfaces, packages and multithreading.
Handle exceptions and apply exception handling in Java.
Develop GUI applications using Java.
Explain and manipulate concepts in automata theory and formal languages.
Describe language acceptance by automata and prove properties formally.
Sketch automata for languages and simplify automata and grammars.
Distinguish normal forms and transform between PDA and CFG.
Define Turing machines and use pumping lemma to judge language classes.
Understand functions, mathematical induction and GCD.
Understand algebraic structures like groups and rings.
Apply counting techniques and algorithms to computer problems.
Analyze graph theory concepts and solve related problems.
Use propositional logic to evaluate mathematical statements.

subjects.prerequisites: Basic programming logic, Data Structure & Algorithm concepts, Basic mathematics and digital electronics
course_outcomes: Understand OS abstractions like process and threads and apply them.
Analyze process scheduling algorithms.
Implement semaphores and IPC mechanisms.
Apply memory and deadlock management techniques to solve problems.
Perform OS tasks in Linux and use shell scripting.

subjects.course_name: Design and Analysis of Algorithms Lab
course_outcomes: Solve problems and analyze complexity for different algorithms.
Compare algorithm behaviours experimentally.
Implement graph traversal and shortest path algorithms.
Evaluate and choose best algorithms for specific applications.
Design algorithms for real-life case studies.

subjects.prerequisites: Algorithm concepts and basic programming logic
course_outcomes: Apply OOP concepts to solve real-time problems using Java.
Use polymorphism and string class features in Java programs.
Implement inheritance, abstract classes and interfaces.
Handle exceptions and errors using Java's error handling.
Develop GUI and multithreaded applications.
